title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research What Actually Matters Before You Publish

tactics.name: Buyer Intent Focus
tactics.description: Prioritize keywords that reflect specific buyer intent rather than broad, competitive terms.
steps: Avoid overly broad keywords like 'coloring book'
caveats: May fail in niche markets with low search volume
source_quotes: Buyer's intent to me is more important than big numbers.

tactics.name: Relevance Over Competition Obsession
tactics.description: Focus on keywords with actual demand rather than zero-competition niches.
steps: Check for demand instead of competition
caveats: Ignoring market trends may lead to low profitability
source_quotes: If there's zero competition, that usually means there's no demand.

tactics.name: Focused Longtail Keywords
tactics.description: Use specific, related keywords to avoid algorithm confusion and improve relevance.
source_quotes: Don't slap 12 keywords together on a book... they have no connection.

heuristics.name: Boost Low-Review Niche Books
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting
source_quotes: Don't publish stuff in corners of the internet waiting for strangers...

claims.statement: Amazon prioritizes relevance over competition in keyword rankings
source_quotes: Relevance is more important than competition obsession.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with unique constraints for higher relevance
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity, problem, and constraint to reduce competition
source_quotes: Don't publish stuff in corners of the internet waiting for strangers...
